articles.headline: Meet the A.I. Jane Austen: Meta Weaves A.I. Throughout Its Apps
articles.snippet: Meta introduced artificially intelligent characters based on Jane Austen, Snoop Dogg and others into Instagram, Facebook and WhatsApp, as the race to lead the technology heats up.
articles.abstract: Meta introduced artificially intelligent characters based on Jane Austen, Snoop Dogg and others into Instagram, Facebook and WhatsApp, as the race to lead the technology heats up.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a WhatsApp text conversation this week, we asked Jane Austen — yes, the 19th-century British author — how she felt about Mr. Darcy, a character from one of her most famous works, “Pride and Prejudice.”
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac and Cade Metz

articles.headline: The New ChatGPT Can ‘See’ and ‘Talk.’ Here’s What It’s Like.
articles.snippet: The image-recognition feature could have many uses, and the voice feature is even more intriguing.
articles.abstract: The image-recognition feature could have many uses, and the voice feature is even more intriguing.
articles.lead_paragraph: ChatGPT — viral artificial intelligence sensation, slayer of boring office work, sworn enemy of high school teachers and Hollywood screenwriters alike — is getting some new powers.

articles.headline: New Trouble Roils China Evergrande, Fueling Real Estate Crisis Fears
articles.snippet: The developer halted critical work to settle its debts and investors dumped their stock amid news that executives were under suspicion by the authorities.
articles.abstract: The developer halted critical work to settle its debts and investors dumped their stock amid news that executives were under suspicion by the authorities.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just a few weeks ago, China Evergrande, the world’s most debt-saddled real estate developer, was writing its next chapter and working to resolve financial disputes with its creditors. Then a stream of bad news came and the pages were torn up.

articles.headline: Vulnerable Republicans Try to Head Off Blame for Shutdown
articles.snippet: Some mainstream House Republicans representing districts won by President Biden have explored a bipartisan stopgap measure as right-wing lawmakers push Congress toward a shutdown.
articles.abstract: Some mainstream House Republicans representing districts won by President Biden have explored a bipartisan stopgap measure as right-wing lawmakers push Congress toward a shutdown.
articles.lead_paragraph: Days before an all-but-certain government shutdown instigated by hard-right Republicans in Washington, Elizabeth Catalino arrived at a Hudson Valley high school looking for answers from her own G.O.P. congressman, Representative Mike Lawler.

articles.headline: Gifts, Gadgets and Greece: Inside a Huawei Lobbying Campaign
articles.snippet: Leaked internal messages detail efforts by the Chinese tech giant to court Greek officials and fight an American-led effort against its technology.
articles.abstract: Leaked internal messages detail efforts by the Chinese tech giant to court Greek officials and fight an American-led effort against its technology.
articles.lead_paragraph: In November 2020, executives at Huawei, the Chinese telecom-equipment maker, exchanged messages about holding a meeting with a “friend” and an “adviser” in Greece.
articles.byline: By Adam Satariano and Eliza Triantafillou

articles.headline: DeSantis Clears a Debate Hurdle. Will It Be Enough to Build On?
articles.snippet: The Florida governor projected confidence onstage, but time is running out to stop his slide in the polls and convince voters he’s the best Trump alternative.
articles.abstract: The Florida governor projected confidence onstage, but time is running out to stop his slide in the polls and convince voters he’s the best Trump alternative.
articles.lead_paragraph: At a time when his standing in the polls has slid — and Republican donors have talked about finding another candidate to stop Donald J. Trump from cruising to the nomination — Gov. Ron DeSantis acted like the former president’s leading challenger at the second Republican presidential debate.
